text: How do "and" and "or" work when combined in one statement?
For some reason this function confused me:

code:
def protocol(port):
    return port == "443" and "https://" or "http://"

text: Can somebody explain the order of what's happening behind the scenes to make this work the way it does.
I understood it as this until I tried it:

code:
def protocol(port):
    if port == "443":
        if bool("https://"):
            return True
    elif bool("http://"):
        return True
    return False

def protocol(port):
    if port == "443":
        return True + "https://"
    else:
        return True + "http://"

text: Is this some sort of special case in Python, or am I completely misunderstanding how statements work?
